intro: Kunstleria keralensis, commonly known as the Kerala grass, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of India. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in marshy areas or along riverbanks. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that produce small, delicate flowers, which are usually wind-pollinated. Due to its unique ecological role and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
